chowski's wanted the fighting to emulate

because this shot is so far-fetched
every single element was computerized
the actors the set the lighting the
camera movements this new technique was
part of universal capture a process
developed by esc that samples and stores
the facial details and expressions of
actors using a multi-camera setup and
photogrametric techniques
photogrammetric which sounds like nine
different classes i took in high school
with that data and a sophisticated
algorithm esc was able to digitally
create shots that would otherwise be
impossible on a real camera with real
actors in a real setting the result is
an action sequence that looks more like
a video game than a film

then breaks apart and plummets into the

piece of the rocket car he thirsts the
tsunami and propels himself onto solid
ground narrowly escaping the massive
wave and his certain demise i would have
done the same thing myself most

imagery but tomohori went for it the
result is cheesier than swiss fondue the
glaciers and waves look worse than

critics and audiences ripped this film

became one of the primary talking points

shame considering it's one of the most

a long time and ago in a theater not all
that far away george lucas released his
iconic space opera star wars the first
film in a mega franchise that continues
to turn out box office smashes many of
the special effects in the original film
still hold up to this day which is
remarkable considering the limited
budget and technology available way back
in the 70s the slew of naysaying studio
execs probably didn't help much either
lucas formed his own visual effects
company industrial light and magic in
1975 and began working on star wars out
of a warehouse in van nuys his team
pioneered a visual effects method of
digital motion control photography which
created the illusion of size using small
models and moving cameras this was
pretty innovative at the time and set
the standard for countless films that
followed 30 years later lucas
re-released star wars taking advantage
of more modern technologies and
inserting new cg characters and settings
into the original frames though some
critics felt these changes were
improvements the vast majority didn't
approve and you can kind of see why
check out this one scene where java the
hut and han solo converse near the
millennium falcon jabba looks digital
and out of place the scene was
originally shot way back in the 70s with
irish actor declan mulholland playing
jabba and lucas had the intention of
replacing him with a stop-motion java
the time and budget didn't allow for
this so the scene was cut you can even
see where han walked closely behind
mulholland which wasn't originally a
problem but you know jabba the hutt now
has a tail so the vfx team had to
simulate han stepping on said tail and
causing this cringe-worthy reaction
enjoy
you think i had a choice
still unsatisfied lucas attempted to fix
this scene again in 2004 and somehow
kind of made it worse maybe you should
have just left it out of the picture
everyone was perfectly fine with not
seeing jabba until return of the jedi
many fans wish they could use the force
to unsee this
